data.Name: Actinolite
data.Description: A green, needle-like amphibole mineral found in metamorphic rocks. It is a member of the hornblende group and forms through metamorphism of magnesium-rich rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Adularia
data.Description: A variety of orthoclase feldspar that is typically colorless to white and found in low-temperature hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Aegirine
data.Description: A dark green pyroxene mineral rich in sodium and iron, commonly found in alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Åkermanite
data.Description: A melilite mineral composed of calcium, magnesium, and silicate, found in metamorphosed limestones and in skarns.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Albite
data.Description: A plagioclase feldspar mineral, typically white or colorless, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks. It is one end member of the plagioclase series.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Alite
data.Description: A calcium silicate mineral found in Portland cement; it is responsible for the early strength gain in concrete.

data.Name: Alkali Feldspar
data.Description: A group of feldspar minerals that include orthoclase, microcline, and sanidine, characterized by the presence of potassium and sodium.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Allanite
data.Description: A complex calcium iron aluminum silicate mineral that often contains rare earth elements, found in granitic pegmatites and metamorphosed iron-rich sediments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Almandine
data.Description: A type of garnet that is typically red to reddish-brown, found in metamorphic rocks and commonly used as a gemstone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Aluminosilicate (Alsio5 Polymorphs)
data.Description: Includes minerals such as andalusite, kyanite, and sillimanite, which are polymorphs with the same chemical formula but different crystal structures.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Alunite
data.Description: A sulfate mineral found in the oxidized zones of sulfide deposits, often associated with the weathering of feldspars and other potassium-rich minerals.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Alunogen
data.Description: An aluminum sulfate mineral that forms as a white fibrous mass in the oxidation zones of sulfide deposits.

data.Name: Amakinite
data.Description: A rare hydroxide mineral consisting of iron and magnesium, typically found in serpentine deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Amesite
data.Description: A magnesium aluminum silicate mineral, part of the serpentine group, found in metamorphic rocks and altered ultramafic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Amphibole
data.Description: A group of inosilicate minerals forming prism or needle-like crystals, including minerals like hornblende, found in both igneous and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Analcime
data.Description: A tectosilicate mineral, part of the zeolite group, often found in basaltic rocks as a secondary mineral.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Anatase
data.Description: A polymorph of titanium dioxide, appearing as a blue to black or brown mineral, often found in metamorphic rocks and as an alteration product in granites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Andalusite
data.Description: An aluminosilicate mineral that is a polymorph of AlSiO5, found in medium-grade metamorphic rocks, known for its cross-shaped inclusions of carbon.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Andesine
data.Description: A plagioclase feldspar mineral, intermediate in composition between albite and anorthite, commonly found in intermediate igneous rocks like andesite.

data.Name: Andradite
data.Description: A calcium iron silicate, one of the species of the garnet group, known for its gem varieties such as topazolite and demantoid.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Anglesite
data.Description: A lead sulfate mineral that forms from the oxidation of galena, found in the oxidized zones of lead ore deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Anhydrite
data.Description: An anhydrous calcium sulfate mineral, similar to gypsum but lacking water; it forms in evaporite deposits from the dehydration of gypsum.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ankerite
data.Description: A carbonate mineral that is part of the dolomite group but contains iron in addition to magnesium, found in sedimentary rocks and hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Annite
data.Description: A dark mica, iron-rich member of the biotite group, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Anorthite
data.Description: A calcium-rich plagioclase feldspar mineral, found in igneous rocks like basalt and gabbro, as well as in some metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Anorthoclase
data.Description: An alkali feldspar mineral that is intermediate between albite and orthoclase, found in volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Anthophyllite
data.Description: An amphibole mineral, magnesium iron silicate, found in metamorphosed ultramafic rocks and associated with asbestos deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Antigorite
data.Description: A mineral of the serpentine group, known for its platy or lamellar habit, found in metamorphosed ultramafic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Antimony Lead
data.Description: Often found as a minor component in lead-antimony ores, used in the production of lead-antimony alloys.

data.Name: Apatite
data.Description: A group of phosphate minerals, widely distributed in all rock types, important for its phosphorus content and used as a gemstone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Apophyllite
data.Description: A group of phyllosilicate minerals, typically found in volcanic rocks and known for their well-formed crystals and high water content.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Aragonite
data.Description: A carbonate mineral, one of the two common, naturally occurring polymorphs of calcium carbonate, CaCO3 (the other being calcite). It is formed by biological and physical processes, including precipitation from marine and freshwater environments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Arfvedsonite
data.Description: A dark amphibole mineral, rich in sodium and iron, found in nepheline syenites and other alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Armalcolite
data.Description: A titanium-rich mineral, named after astronauts Armstrong, Aldrin, and Collins; found in lunar basalts and some terrestrial mafic igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Arsenopyrite
data.Description: A silver-white to steel-gray metallic sulfide mineral, the most common ore mineral of arsenic, found in high-temperature hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Atacamite
data.Description: A copper chloride hydroxide mineral, formed in arid climates or in rapidly oxidizing copper sulfide deposits.

data.Name: Augite
data.Description: A common pyroxene mineral, found in igneous rocks such as basalt and gabbro, as well as in some metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Awaruite
data.Description: A naturally occurring nickel-iron alloy, found in river placers and ultramafic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Axinite
data.Description: A group of brown to violet borosilicate minerals, found in metamorphic rocks and pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Azurite
data.Description: A blue copper carbonate mineral, often found in the oxidized zones of copper ore deposits, used historically as a blue pigment.

data.Name: Babingtonite
data.Description: A rare calcium iron silicate mineral, found in granite pegmatites and basaltic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Baddeleyite
data.Description: A zirconium oxide mineral, found in mafic igneous rocks and used in radiometric dating.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Barite
data.Description: A barium sulfate mineral, commonly found in hydrothermal veins and as a gangue mineral in lead-zinc deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Barroisite
data.Description: A member of the amphibole group, similar to hornblende, found in metamorphosed mafic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Bassanite
data.Description: A calcium sulfate mineral, essentially half-water gypsum, found in arid soils and desert deposits.

data.Name: Beidellite
data.Description: A type of smectite clay mineral, similar to montmorillonite, found in soils and sedimentary rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Berthierine
data.Description: An iron-rich chlorite mineral, found in banded iron formations and iron-rich sedimentary rocks.

data.Name: Beryl
data.Description: A beryllium aluminum silicate mineral, known for gem varieties such as emerald and aquamarine, found in granitic pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Bindheimite
data.Description: A lead antimonate mineral, typically found in the oxidized zones of lead-antimony deposits.

data.Name: Biosilica
data.Description: Biosilica refers to biogenic silica, which is silica produced by organisms. It is found in the structures of various plants and animals, such as diatoms, sponges, and some higher plants. Biosilica is used in studies related to biomineralization and has applications in biomaterials science due to its unique properties and structures.

data.Name: Biotite
data.Description: A common phyllosilicate mineral within the mica group, rich in iron and magnesium, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Bischofite
data.Description: A hydrous magnesium chloride mineral, found in evaporite deposits and as a brine in salt wells.

data.Name: Bixbyite
data.Description: A manganese iron oxide mineral, found in volcanic rocks and pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Bloedite
data.Description: A sulfate mineral of sodium and magnesium, found in saline lake deposits and evaporites.

data.Name: Böhmite
data.Description: An aluminum oxide hydroxide mineral, found in bauxite deposits, a principal ore of aluminum.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Bornite
data.Description: A copper iron sulfide mineral, known for its iridescent tarnish, found in hydrothermal veins and contact metamorphic zones.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Brochantite
data.Description: A green copper sulfate mineral, found in the oxidized zones of copper deposits.

data.Name: Brookite
data.Description: A polymorph of titanium dioxide, found in alpine veins and metamorphosed limestone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Brownmillerite
data.Description: A calcium iron aluminum oxide mineral, found in cement clinker and some metamorphosed iron-rich sediments.

data.Name: Brucite
data.Description: A magnesium hydroxide mineral, found in ultramafic rocks and as an alteration product of periclase in marble.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Buchwaldite
data.Description: A rare sodium calcium phosphate mineral, found in iron meteorites.

data.Name: Bustamite
data.Description: A calcium manganese silicate mineral, found in metamorphosed manganese-rich deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Butlerite
data.Description: A hydrous iron sulfate mineral, found in oxidized zones of sulfide ore deposits.

data.Name: Bytownite
data.Description: A plagioclase feldspar mineral, more calcium-rich than anorthite, found in mafic igneous rocks.

data.Name: Calcic Plagioclase
data.Description: A series of minerals within the plagioclase feldspar solid solution series, ranging from albite to anorthite, found in igneous rocks.

data.Name: Calcite
data.Description: A carbonate mineral and the most stable polymorph of calcium carbonate (CaCO3), found in a variety of geological environments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Calcium Magnesium-Rich Siderite
data.Description: A carbonate mineral, a magnesium-rich variety of siderite, found in sedimentary iron deposits.

data.Name: Cancrinite
data.Description: A complex carbonate and silicate of sodium, calcium, and aluminum, found in alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cannilloite
data.Description: A rare gypsum-like mineral, found in oxidized copper deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Carbon
data.Description: Elemental mineral, found in various forms including diamond and graphite, essential for life.

data.Name: Carbonate Mineral
data.Description: A group of minerals composed primarily of carbonate ions in combination with calcium, magnesium, iron, or other metals, found in sedimentary rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Carnallite
data.Description: A potassium magnesium chloride mineral, found in evaporite deposits, used as a source of potassium in fertilizers.

data.Name: Carpholite
data.Description: A manganese silicate mineral, found in metamorphosed manganese-rich sediments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Carrollite
data.Description: A copper cobalt sulfide mineral, found in hydrothermal copper-cobalt deposits.

data.Name: Cassiterite
data.Description: A tin oxide mineral, the primary ore of tin, found in hydrothermal veins and pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Celadonite
data.Description: A green mica mineral, found in altered volcanic rocks and as a pigment in artistic paints.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Celestine
data.Description: A strontium sulfate mineral, found in sedimentary rocks and used in the production of strontium compounds.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Celsian
data.Description: A barium feldspar mineral, found in high-temperature metamorphic rocks and granites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cerussite
data.Description: A lead carbonate mineral, found in the oxidized zones of lead ore deposits, often associated with galena.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chabazite
data.Description: A tectosilicate mineral of the zeolite group, found in basaltic rocks and used in water softeners and molecular sieves.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chalcanthite
data.Description: A water-soluble blue copper sulfate mineral, often found in the oxidized zones of copper deposits and used historically for copper extraction.

data.Name: Chalcocite
data.Description: A dark gray copper sulfide mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and as a primary mineral in hypogene ore deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chalcopyrite
data.Description: A brassy yellow copper iron sulfide mineral, the most common copper ore, found in various geological environments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chamosite
data.Description: An iron-rich chlorite mineral, found in iron ore deposits and as a metamorphic alteration product of iron-rich minerals.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chert
data.Description: A hard, fine-grained sedimentary rock composed of microcrystalline or cryptocrystalline silica, often found in limestone and dolomite.

data.Name: Chesterite
data.Description: A member of the amphibole group, similar to cummingtonite, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chlinochlore
data.Description: A chlorite mineral, typically green, found in low-grade metamorphic rocks and as an alteration product in igneous rocks.

data.Name: Chlorapatite
data.Description: A chlorinated calcium phosphate mineral, found in igneous rocks and pegmatites, similar to fluorapatite but with chlorine.

data.Name: Chlorite
data.Description: A group of phyllosilicate minerals, common in metamorphic rocks as a product of hydrothermal alteration, and in soils.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chlorite/Smectite
data.Description: Mixed-layer clay minerals, indicating transitional stages between smectite and chlorite, common in diagenetic and low-grade metamorphic environments.

data.Name: Chloritoid
data.Description: A blue-green silicate mineral, found in metamorphic rocks, especially those of pelitic origin.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chondrodite
data.Description: A nesosilicate mineral, often yellow to red, found in metamorphosed limestone and skarns, associated with contact metamorphism.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chromite
data.Description: An iron chromium oxide mineral, the principal ore of chromium, found in ultramafic rocks such as peridotite.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chronium Spinel
data.Description: A group of spinel minerals with chromium, found in ultramafic igneous rocks, important for their refractory properties.

data.Name: Chrysocolla
data.Description: A hydrated copper silicate mineral, with a blue-green color, found in the oxidized zones of copper ore bodies.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Chrysotile
data.Description: A type of asbestos, a fibrous silicate mineral, found in serpentine rocks, historically used for its fire-resistant properties.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cinnabar
data.Description: A bright red mercury sulfide mineral, the principal ore of mercury, found in hydrothermal veins and hot springs.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Clay
data.Description: A natural, earthy material composed of fine-grained minerals, primarily clay minerals, used in ceramics and as a soil type.

data.Name: Clinoamphibole
data.Description: A subgroup of amphibole minerals that crystallize in the monoclinic system, including minerals like hornblende.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Clinochlore
data.Description: A chlorite mineral, typically green, found in low-grade metamorphic rocks and as an alteration product in igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Clinoenstatite
data.Description: A pyroxene mineral, the monoclinic polymorph of enstatite, found in some meteorites and ultramafic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Clinoferrosilite
data.Description: A monoclinic pyroxene mineral, an iron-rich end-member of the pyroxene group, found in metamorphic and igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Clinohumite
data.Description: A member of the humite group of minerals, found in high-pressure metamorphic rocks and as inclusions in diamonds.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Clinoptil Heuland
data.Description: Clinoptilolite and Heulandite are both zeolites, and they share similar structural characteristics because they belong to the same mineral group. They can occur together in the same environments, such as in altered volcanic rocks. While they don't form a solid solution series (a complete gradation in composition from one mineral to another), their occurrence together can sometimes lead to intergrowths or mixed mineral specimens where both minerals are present.

data.Name: Clinoptilolite
data.Description: A zeolite mineral, used in water purification, gas separation, and as a soil treatment, found in volcanic tuffs.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Clinopyroxene
data.Description: A group of monoclinic pyroxene minerals, common in igneous and high-grade metamorphic rocks, including minerals like augite and jadeite.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Clinozoisite
data.Description: A monoclinic mineral of the epidote group, typically found in metamorphosed calcium-rich rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Clintonite
data.Description: A mica group mineral, also known as brittle mica, found in metamorphosed marbles and calc-silicate rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Coal
data.Description: A combustible black or brownish-black sedimentary rock, formed from ancient plant material, used as a fossil fuel.

data.Name: Coesite
data.Description: A high-pressure polymorph of silica, found in meteorite impact craters and in very high-pressure metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cohenite
data.Description: An iron carbide mineral, found in iron meteorites and steel slag.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Colusite
data.Description: A complex copper-iron-arsenic sulfide mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and replacement deposits.

data.Name: Cordierite
data.Description: A magnesium iron alumino-silicate mineral, known for its pleochroism, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks and some granites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Corrensite
data.Description: A mixed-layer clay mineral, combining layers of chlorite and smectite, found in hydrothermally altered volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Corundum
data.Description: A crystalline form of aluminum oxide, known for gem varieties such as sapphire and ruby, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cotunnite
data.Description: A lead chloride mineral, formed in fumarolic conditions and as a sublimate from volcanic gases.

data.Name: Covellite
data.Description: A copper sulfide mineral, known for its indigo blue color, found in the supergene enrichment zone of copper deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cristobalite
data.Description: A high-temperature polymorph of silica, found in volcanic rocks and as a product of devitrification of volcanic glass.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Crossite
data.Description: A member of the amphibole group, similar to glaucophane, found in high-pressure metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cryolite
data.Description: A rare mineral consisting of sodium aluminum fluoride, historically used in aluminum processing and found in Ivigtut, Greenland.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cubanite
data.Description: A copper iron sulfide mineral, found in high-temperature ore deposits, often associated with chalcopyrite.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cummingtonite
data.Description: An iron-magnesium amphibole mineral, found in metamorphic rocks, particularly those subjected to high temperatures.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cuprite
data.Description: A red copper oxide mineral, found in the oxidized zones of copper deposits, known for its high refractive index.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Cuspidine
data.Description: A rare calcium silicate fluoride mineral, found in skarns and contact metamorphic zones.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Damaraite
data.Description: A rare mineral found in the Damara region, often associated with metamorphic rocks.

data.Name: Daphnite
data.Description: A member of the chlorite group, typically found in low-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Datolite
data.Description: A borosilicate mineral, found in skarns and hydrothermal veins, often associated with copper deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Daubreelite
data.Description: An iron chromium sulfide mineral, found in iron meteorites and rarely in mafic igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Dawsonite
data.Description: A sodium aluminum carbonate hydroxide mineral, often found in sedimentary rocks and alkaline igneous environments.

data.Name: Deerite
data.Description: A rare silicate mineral, found in high-pressure metamorphic rocks, particularly in blueschist facies.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Diamond
data.Description: A crystalline form of carbon, renowned for its physical qualities, found in kimberlite pipes and alluvial deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Diaspore
data.Description: An aluminum oxide hydroxide mineral, found in bauxite deposits and often associated with corundum and gibbsite.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Dickite
data.Description: A kaolinite mineral, one of the clay minerals, found in hydrothermal veins and altered volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Digenite
data.Description: A copper sulfide mineral, found in the supergene zones of copper deposits, often associated with chalcocite.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Diopside
data.Description: A calcium magnesium silicate mineral, part of the pyroxene group, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Dioptase
data.Description: A bright green copper silicate mineral, found in the oxidized zones of copper deposits, prized as a gemstone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Dolomite
data.Description: A carbonate mineral, composed of calcium magnesium carbonate, found in sedimentary rocks like limestone and dolostone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Dravite
data.Description: A dark brown or black variety of tourmaline, found in metamorphic rocks and granitic pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Dumortierite
data.Description: An aluminum borosilicate mineral, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks and pegmatites, used as a gemstone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Eastonite
data.Description: A member of the mica group, similar to biotite, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ecandrewsite
data.Description: A rare zinc iron manganese oxide mineral, found in metamorphosed manganese deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Eckermannite
data.Description: A sodium magnesium iron silicate, part of the amphibole group, found in alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Edenite
data.Description: An amphibole mineral, found in metamorphic rocks and occasionally in igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Eitelite
data.Description: A rare carbonate mineral, sodium magnesium carbonate, found in marine evaporite deposits.

data.Name: Elbaite
data.Description: A sodium lithium aluminum borosilicate, a colorful variety of tourmaline, used as a gemstone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ellenbergerite
data.Description: A rare magnesium aluminum silicate mineral, found in high-pressure metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Enargite
data.Description: A copper arsenic sulfide mineral, found in high-temperature hydrothermal veins, important as a copper ore.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Enstatite (Ortho-)
data.Description: A magnesium silicate mineral, part of the pyroxene group, found in igneous and high-temperature metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Epidote
data.Description: A calcium aluminum iron silicate mineral, found in metamorphic rocks, known for its pistachio-green color.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Epsomite
data.Description: A magnesium sulfate mineral, also known as Epsom salt, found in evaporite deposits and as a secondary mineral in caves.

data.Name: Erionite
data.Description: A fibrous zeolite mineral, found in volcanic ash altered by weathering and groundwater, known for its health hazards.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Eskolaite
data.Description: A chromium oxide mineral, found in chromium-rich metamorphic rocks and as an alteration product of chromite.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Esseneite
data.Description: A rare calcium iron silicate mineral, found in skarns and contact metamorphic zones.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Eudialite
data.Description: A complex silicate mineral, rich in rare earth elements, found in alkaline igneous rocks such as nepheline syenites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Fassaite
data.Description: A variety of augite, a clinopyroxene mineral, found in metamorphosed carbonate rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Fayalite
data.Description: An iron-rich olivine mineral, found in felsic igneous rocks and iron-rich meteorites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Feldspar
data.Description: A group of silicate minerals that make up about 41% of the Earth's continental crust, found in igneous, metamorphic, and sedimentary rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferro-Actinolite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in metamorphic rocks, particularly in amphibolites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferroan Calcite
data.Description: A calcite mineral containing significant amounts of iron as an impurity, found in sedimentary rocks.

data.Name: Ferroan Dolomite
data.Description: A variety of dolomite with significant iron replacing magnesium, found in sedimentary rocks.

data.Name: Ferro-Anthophyllite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in iron-rich metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferrobarroisite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferrocarpholite
data.Description: An iron-rich silicate mineral, found in low-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferroceladonite
data.Description: An iron-rich mica mineral, found in altered volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferro-Eckermannite
data.Description: An iron-rich variety of the amphibole mineral eckermannite, found in alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferro-Edenite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferrogedrite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferroglaucophane
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in blueschist facies metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferrokaersutite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferronyboite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in high-pressure metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferropargasite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferrorichterite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferrosilite
data.Description: An iron-rich pyroxene mineral, found in igneous and high-temperature metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferrotschermakite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ferrowinchite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Fibrolite (Fibrous Sillimanite)
data.Description: A fibrous form of sillimanite, an aluminum silicate mineral, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Fluorapatite
data.Description: A calcium phosphate mineral, fluorine-rich, found in igneous rocks and as a primary source of phosphate for fertilizer.

data.Name: Fluorite
data.Description: A calcium fluoride mineral, known for its wide range of colors and strong fluorescence, found in hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Forsterite
data.Description: A magnesium-rich olivine mineral, found in ultramafic igneous rocks and in some metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Foshagite
data.Description: A rare calcium silicate mineral, found in contact metamorphosed limestone and in some alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Fossils
data.Description: Preserved remains, impressions, or traces of once-living organisms from the past, found in sedimentary rocks.

data.Name: Franklinite
data.Description: An iron zinc manganese oxide mineral, found in the Franklin and Sterling Hill mines, New Jersey, known for its magnetic properties.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Fullerite
data.Description: A polymorph of carbon, structured in spherical fullerenes or "buckyballs," found in some meteorites and synthesized in laboratories.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Gahnite
data.Description: A zinc aluminum oxide, a member of the spinel group, found in metamorphosed zinc deposits and pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Galaxite
data.Description: A manganese-rich spinel mineral, found in metamorphosed manganese deposits and as an accessory in some granites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Galena
data.Description: A lead sulfide mineral, the primary ore of lead, found in hydrothermal veins and as a replacement mineral in limestone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Garnet
data.Description: A group of silicate minerals with various compositions and colors, used as gemstones and abrasives, found in metamorphic, igneous, and some sedimentary rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Gedrite
data.Description: An amphibole mineral, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks, particularly in amphibolites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Gehlenite
data.Description: A calcium aluminum silicate mineral, found in metamorphosed limestones and in contact metamorphic skarns.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Geikielite
data.Description: A magnesium titanium oxide mineral, found in ultramafic igneous rocks and some metamorphosed dolomites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Gersdorffite
data.Description: A nickel arsenic sulfide mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and as a minor ore of nickel.

data.Name: Gibbsite
data.Description: An aluminum hydroxide mineral, a major component of bauxite, the principal ore of aluminum.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Gismondine
data.Description: A calcium aluminum silicate zeolite mineral, found in basaltic rocks and as a product of volcanic ash alteration.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Glauconite
data.Description: A greenish iron potassium phyllosilicate mineral, found in marine sedimentary rocks, indicative of slow sedimentation rates.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Glaucophane
data.Description: A blue sodium iron magnesium amphibole mineral, found in blueschist facies metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Gmelinite
data.Description: A zeolite mineral, found in basaltic rocks and as a secondary mineral in gneisses and schists.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Goethite
data.Description: An iron oxide hydroxide mineral, found as a weathering product of iron-bearing minerals and in some iron ore deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Goyazite
data.Description: A rare strontium aluminum phosphate mineral, found in pegmatites and hydrothermal veins.

data.Name: Grandidierite
data.Description: A rare blue-green to greenish-blue silicate mineral, found in pegmatites and known for its trichroic properties.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Graphite
data.Description: A form of carbon with a hexagonal crystal structure, used as a lubricant, in pencils, and as a moderator in nuclear reactors, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Greenalite
data.Description: An iron silicate hydroxide mineral, found in banded iron formations and as a precursor to iron ore deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Grossular
data.Description: A calcium aluminum garnet, ranging in color from green to red to yellow, found in metamorphic rocks and contact metamorphic skarns.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Grunerite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in iron formations and high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Gunningite
data.Description: A zinc sulfate mineral, found in oxidized zones of zinc deposits and as an alteration product of sphalerite.

data.Name: Gypsum
data.Description: A soft sulfate mineral composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate, used in plaster and as a fertilizer, found in sedimentary rocks and evaporite deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Gypsum Anhydrite
data.Description: Refers to the close association of gypsum (hydrated calcium sulfate) and anhydrite (anhydrous calcium sulfate) in evaporite deposits.

data.Name: Halite
data.Description: Commonly known as rock salt, a sodium chloride mineral, found in evaporite deposits and used extensively in the chemical industry and for de-icing.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Harmotome
data.Description: A barium-bearing zeolite mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and basaltic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hastingsite
data.Description: An iron-rich amphibole mineral, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hausmannite
data.Description: A manganese oxide mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and as a product of metamorphism in manganese deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Haüyne
data.Description: A tectosilicate mineral with sulfate, found in alkaline igneous rocks like nepheline syenites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Heavy Minerals
data.Description: Minerals with a density greater than 2.9 g/cm³, often found concentrated in placer deposits; includes minerals like zircon, rutile, and ilmenite.

data.Name: Heazlewoodite
data.Description: A nickel sulfide mineral, found in serpentinite rocks and as a low-temperature alteration product of nickel sulfide ores.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hectorite
data.Description: A type of smectite clay mineral, rich in lithium, found in bentonite deposits and used in various industrial applications.

data.Name: Hedenbergite
data.Description: An iron-rich clinopyroxene mineral, found in skarns, iron-rich igneous rocks, and some metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hematite
data.Description: An iron oxide mineral, the most important ore of iron, known for its reddish streak, found in sedimentary rocks and as a weathering product.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hemimorphite
data.Description: A zinc silicate hydroxide mineral, found in the oxidized zones of zinc deposits, often associated with smithsonite.

data.Name: Hercynite
data.Description: An iron aluminum oxide, a member of the spinel group, found in metamorphosed iron-rich sediments and some igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Heterogenite
data.Description: A cobalt oxide hydroxide mineral, found in the oxidized zones of cobalt-rich ore deposits.

data.Name: Heulandite
data.Description: A zeolite mineral, found in basaltic rocks and as a product of volcanic ash alteration, used in water softeners.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hexahydrite
data.Description: A magnesium sulfate mineral, found in evaporite deposits and as a secondary mineral in sulfide ore bodies.

data.Name: Hibonite
data.Description: A calcium aluminum oxide mineral, found in calcium-aluminum-rich inclusions in some chondritic meteorites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hibschite
data.Description: A variety of grossular garnet containing hydroxide, found in contact metamorphosed limestones and skarns.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hinsdalite
data.Description: A lead aluminum phosphate sulfate mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and as an alteration product in lead deposits.

data.Name: Högbomite
data.Description: A complex aluminum titanium oxide mineral, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks and some granulites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hollandite
data.Description: A barium manganese oxide mineral, found in manganese deposits and as a pigment in pottery.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Holmquistite
data.Description: A lithium magnesium aluminum silicate, part of the amphibole group, found in lithium-rich pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hornblende
data.Description: A complex dark-colored amphibole mineral, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks, common in granites and syenites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Howieite
data.Description: A sodium iron manganese silicate mineral, found in metamorphosed manganese deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Humite
data.Description: A group of nesosilicate minerals found in high-pressure metamorphic rocks and as inclusions in diamonds.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Huntite
data.Description: A carbonate mineral, composed of magnesium and calcium, found in evaporite deposits and as a minor component in some limestones.

data.Name: Hydrocarbon
data.Description: Organic compounds consisting primarily of hydrogen and carbon, found in crude oil and natural gas deposits.

data.Name: Hydrogarnet
data.Description: A group of minerals in the garnet group that incorporate hydroxide into their structure, found in metamorphosed limestones and skarns.

data.Name: Hydrogrossular
data.Description: A variety of garnet with hydroxide partially replacing silica, found in metamorphosed limestones and skarns.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Hypersthene
data.Description: A magnesium iron silicate mineral, part of the pyroxene group, found in igneous and high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Illite
data.Description: A group of clay minerals, structurally similar to mica, found in marine shales and non-marine sediments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Illite Chlorite
data.Description: A mixed-layer clay mineral, combining layers of illite and chlorite, found in diagenetic to low-grade metamorphic rocks.

data.Name: Illite Mica
data.Description: Refers to illite minerals with a mica-like structure, found in shales and other fine-grained sedimentary rocks.

data.Name: Illite Smectite
data.Description: Mixed-layer clay minerals, indicating transitional stages between smectite and illite, common in diagenetic environments.

data.Name: Ilmenite
data.Description: A titanium-iron oxide mineral, the main source of titanium and used in the manufacture of titanium dioxide for paint.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ilvaite
data.Description: A complex iron calcium silicate mineral, found in skarns and contact metamorphic environments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Iron Oxide
data.Description: Minerals composed primarily of iron and oxygen, such as hematite (Fe2O3) and magnetite (Fe3O4), important as iron ores.

data.Name: Iron Metal
data.Description: Elemental iron in its metallic form, used extensively in construction and manufacturing.

data.Name: Iron-Rich Chlorite
data.Description: A chlorite mineral with a higher iron content, typically found in metamorphic rocks.

data.Name: Jadeite
data.Description: A pyroxene mineral, one of the two minerals commonly known as jade, prized for its ornamental uses.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Jarosite
data.Description: A potassium iron sulfate mineral, often formed as a weathering product in arid climates or from the oxidation of sulfide ores.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Jimthompsonite
data.Description: A magnesium iron silicate mineral, part of the amphibole group, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Johannsenite
data.Description: A manganese calcium silicate mineral, part of the pyroxene group, found in metamorphosed manganese deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kaersutite
data.Description: A titanium-rich amphibole mineral, found in alkaline igneous rocks and some metamorphosed limestones.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kainite
data.Description: A hydrated potassium magnesium sulfate chloride mineral, found in evaporite deposits.

data.Name: Kalsilite
data.Description: A potassium aluminum silicate mineral, found in potassium-rich volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kamacite (Α-Feni)
data.Description: An iron-nickel alloy, primarily found in iron meteorites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kaolinite
data.Description: A clay mineral, part of the group of industrial minerals, used for the production of porcelain and as a raw material in paper, rubber, and paint.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kaolinite Chlorite
data.Description: A mixed-layer clay mineral, combining layers of kaolinite and chlorite, found in soils and sedimentary rocks.

data.Name: Katophorite
data.Description: A sodium calcium magnesium iron aluminum silicate amphibole, found in alkali-rich igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kerogen
data.Description: A mixture of organic chemical compounds that make up a portion of the organic matter in sedimentary rocks, a precursor to oil and gas.

data.Name: Kerolite
data.Description: A talc-like mineral, part of the clay mineral group, found in altered ultramafic rocks.

data.Name: K-Feldspar
data.Description: Potassium feldspar minerals including orthoclase and microcline, common in igneous and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: K-Hollandite
data.Description: A barium manganese oxide mineral, similar to hollandite, found in manganese deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kieserite
data.Description: A magnesium sulfate mineral, found in evaporite deposits, used as a fertilizer.

data.Name: Kirschsteinite
data.Description: A calcium iron silicate mineral, part of the olivine group, found in metamorphosed iron-rich sediments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kornerupine
data.Description: A magnesium aluminum borosilicate mineral, found in metamorphic rocks, used as a gemstone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kosmochlor
data.Description: A sodium chromium silicate mineral, part of the pyroxene group, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kutnohorite
data.Description: A rare calcium manganese carbonate mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and as a gangue mineral in manganese deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Kyanite
data.Description: An aluminum silicate mineral, used as a refractory and in ceramics, found in high-pressure metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Labradorite
data.Description: A calcium sodium feldspar mineral, known for its iridescent optical effect or "schiller," found in mafic igneous rocks.

data.Name: Larnite
data.Description: A calcium silicate mineral, found in metamorphosed limestone and as a product of cement clinker.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Laumontite
data.Description: A calcium aluminum silicate zeolite mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and altered volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Laurionite
data.Description: A lead chloride hydroxide mineral, found in the oxidized zones of lead ore deposits.

data.Name: Lautite
data.Description: A copper arsenic sulfide mineral, found in hydrothermal veins associated with other copper and arsenic minerals.

data.Name: Lawsonite
data.Description: A calcium aluminum hydroxide silicate mineral, found in blueschist facies metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Lazulite
data.Description: A magnesium aluminum phosphate mineral, part of the lazulite-scorzalite series, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Lazurite
data.Description: A component of lapis lazuli, a sodium calcium aluminum silicate sulfate mineral, prized for its intense blue color.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Lead
data.Description: A dense, soft, low-melting metal used in batteries and various alloys, found natively and in minerals like galena.

data.Name: Lead Oxide
data.Description: Compounds of lead and oxygen, used in lead-acid batteries and glass making.

data.Name: Leonite
data.Description: A potassium magnesium sulfate mineral, found in evaporite deposits.

data.Name: Lepidolite
data.Description: A lithium-rich mica mineral, used as a source of lithium and in heat-resistant glass and ceramics.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Leucite
data.Description: A potassium aluminum silicate mineral, found in potassium-rich volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Leucoxene
data.Description: An alteration product of titanium-bearing minerals like ilmenite, used as a titanium ore.

data.Name: Libethenite
data.Description: A copper phosphate hydroxide mineral, found in the oxidized zones of copper ore deposits.

data.Name: Limonite
data.Description: An amorphous iron oxide used as an iron ore and pigment, a composite of hydrated iron oxides.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Linnaeite
data.Description: A cobalt sulfide mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and as a byproduct in nickel sulfide ores.

data.Name: Litharge
data.Description: A lead oxide mineral, used in the manufacture of batteries and glass.

data.Name: Lizardite
data.Description: A type of serpentine mineral, common in metamorphosed ultramafic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Loeweite
data.Description: A sodium magnesium sulfate mineral, found in saline lake deposits.

data.Name: Löllingite
data.Description: An iron arsenide mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Maghemite
data.Description: A magnetic iron oxide mineral, similar to magnetite but with more vacancies in its crystal structure.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesio-Arfvedsonite
data.Description: A magnesium-rich amphibole mineral, found in alkali igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesiocarpholite
data.Description: A magnesium aluminum silicate hydroxide mineral, found in low-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesioferrite
data.Description: A magnesium iron oxide mineral, part of the spinel group, found in metamorphosed iron-rich sediments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesiohastingsite
data.Description: A magnesium-rich amphibole mineral, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesiohornblende
data.Description: A magnesium-rich amphibole mineral, common in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesiokatophorite
data.Description: A sodium magnesium iron aluminum silicate amphibole, found in alkali-rich igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesioriebeckite
data.Description: A sodium magnesium iron silicate amphibole, found in blueschist and greenschist facies metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesiosadanagite
data.Description: A complex magnesium aluminum iron silicate amphibole, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesiostaurolite
data.Description: A magnesium-rich staurolite mineral, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesiotaramite
data.Description: A magnesium-rich amphibole mineral, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesiowustite
data.Description: A magnesium iron oxide mineral, found in the Earth's lower mantle.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesite
data.Description: A magnesium carbonate mineral, used as a refractory material and as a source of magnesium, found in ultramafic rocks and evaporite deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Magnesium-Rich Siderite
data.Description: A variation of siderite (iron carbonate) with a higher magnesium content, typically found in sedimentary iron deposits.

data.Name: Magnetite
data.Description: An iron oxide mineral, one of the main ores of iron and known for its magnetic properties, found in igneous, metamorphic, and sedimentary rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Majorite
data.Description: A type of garnet found in the Earth's mantle, particularly in regions subjected to high pressures like subduction zones.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Malachite
data.Description: A copper carbonate hydroxide mineral, known for its vibrant green color, used as a gemstone and copper ore, found in the oxidation zones of copper deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Manganese Carbonate
data.Description: Often refers to rhodochrosite (manganese(II) carbonate), found in hydrothermal veins and as a secondary mineral in manganese deposits.

data.Name: Manganese-Rich Calcite
data.Description: A variety of calcite with a significant manganese content, giving it a pink color, found in some sedimentary rocks.

data.Name: Manganite
data.Description: A manganese oxide hydroxide mineral, found in manganese deposits and used as an ore of manganese.

data.Name: Manganosite
data.Description: A manganese oxide mineral, typically found in manganese-rich slag and as a product of metamorphism.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Marcasite
data.Description: An iron sulfide mineral, similar to pyrite but with a different crystal structure, found in sedimentary rocks and hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Margarite
data.Description: A calcium-rich mica, found in metamorphic rocks, particularly in contact metamorphic zones.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Marialite
data.Description: A member of the scapolite group, a sodium calcium aluminum silicate chloride mineral, found in metamorphic and igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Meionite
data.Description: Another member of the scapolite group, a calcium aluminum silicate carbonate mineral, found in metamorphic and igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Melanterite
data.Description: An iron sulfate mineral, formed as a weathering product of iron sulfides, found in mining environments and coal seams.

data.Name: Melilite
data.Description: A group of sorosilicate minerals found in calcium-rich igneous rocks like nephelinites and melilitites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Merwinite
data.Description: A calcium magnesium silicate mineral, found in contact metamorphosed limestones and dolomites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Mesolite
data.Description: A sodium calcium aluminum silicate mineral, part of the zeolite group, found in cavities in basalt and other volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Mica
data.Description: A group of sheet silicate minerals including muscovite, biotite, and phlogopite, common in igneous and metamorphic rocks.

data.Name: Microcline
data.Description: A potassium feldspar mineral, known for its grid-like twinning, found in granitic rocks and pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Millerite
data.Description: A nickel sulfide mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and as a secondary mineral in nickel-bearing ores.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Minnesotaite
data.Description: An iron silicate mineral, found in iron formations and high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Mixedlayerchloritesmectite
