data.Description: A clay mineral with alternating layers of chlorite and smectite, indicative of varying diagenetic conditions.

data.Name: Mixedlayerillitesmectite
data.Description: A clay mineral with alternating layers of illite and smectite, common in diagenetic environments and used to assess thermal maturity in sedimentary basins.

data.Name: Moganite
data.Description: A polymorph of silica, found in some chalcedony where it forms in arid environments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Molybdenite
data.Description: A molybdenum sulfide mineral, the primary ore of molybdenum, found in hydrothermal veins and pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Monazite
data.Description: A rare earth phosphate mineral, used in electronics and as a source of thorium, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Monmorillonite Illite
data.Description: A mixed-layer clay mineral, combining montmorillonite and illite layers, found in sedimentary rocks.

data.Name: Monticellite
data.Description: A calcium magnesium silicate mineral, found in contact metamorphosed limestones and in some alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Montmorillonite
data.Description: A group of smectite clay minerals, known for their swelling properties, used in drilling muds and as a sealant.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Mordenite
data.Description: A zeolite mineral, found in altered volcanic ash and used in water softeners and as a catalyst in petrochemical processing.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Mullite
data.Description: An aluminum silicate mineral, found in high-temperature industrial processes and as a product of metamorphism.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Muscovite
data.Description: A potassium aluminum mica, common in igneous and metamorphic rocks, used in electrical insulators and heat-resistant materials.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Nacrite
data.Description: A polymorph of kaolinite, a type of clay mineral, found in hydrothermal environments and sedimentary rocks.

data.Name: Nahcolite
data.Description: A natural sodium bicarbonate mineral, found in evaporite deposits and used in baking soda production.

data.Name: Native Copper
data.Description: Elemental copper in its metallic form, found in volcanic rocks and ancient lava flows.

data.Name: Natroalunite
data.Description: A sodium aluminum sulfate mineral, found in acidic volcanic environments as a product of sulfide oxidation.

data.Name: Natrolite
data.Description: A sodium aluminum silicate zeolite mineral, found in cavities in basalt and other volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Nepheline
data.Description: A sodium aluminum silicate mineral, found in silica-undersaturated igneous rocks like nepheline syenites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Nontronite
data.Description: An iron-rich smectite clay mineral, found in soils and as a weathering product of iron-bearing minerals.

data.Name: Norbergite
data.Description: A magnesium silicate mineral, part of the humite group, found in metamorphosed dolomites and serpentinites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Nosean
data.Description: A sodium aluminum silicate sulfate mineral, found in alkaline igneous rocks like phonolites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Nyböite
data.Description: A complex sodium calcium magnesium iron aluminum silicate amphibole, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Oligoclase
data.Description: A plagioclase feldspar mineral, intermediate in composition, found in igneous rocks like granite and diorite.

data.Name: Olivine
data.Description: A magnesium iron silicate mineral, a primary component of the Earth's upper mantle, found in mafic and ultramafic igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Omphacite
data.Description: A clinopyroxene mineral, found in high-pressure metamorphic rocks like eclogites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Opal
data.Description: A hydrated silica mineraloid, prized for its play of color and used as a gemstone, found in sedimentary rocks and as a product of silica precipitation.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Orpiment
data.Description: An arsenic sulfide mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and as a sublimation product around volcanic fumaroles.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Orthoamphibole
data.Description: A subgroup of amphibole minerals with specific crystallographic orientations, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Orthoclase
data.Description: A potassium feldspar mineral, common in granite and other felsic igneous rocks, used in ceramics and glass-making.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Orthoenstatite
data.Description: A high-temperature polymorph of enstatite, a magnesium silicate mineral, found in high-temperature igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Orthopyroxene
data.Description: A group of pyroxene minerals including enstatite and hypersthene, common in mafic and ultramafic igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Osumilite
data.Description: A complex potassium aluminum silicate mineral, found in high-temperature metamorphic rocks and some granites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Palmierite
data.Description: A potassium lead sulfate mineral, often found in oxidized zones of lead ore deposits.

data.Name: Palygorskite
data.Description: A magnesium aluminum silicate clay mineral, used in medicine and as a pozzolanic material in cements.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Paragonite
data.Description: A sodium mica, similar to muscovite but sodium-rich, found in low-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pargasite
data.Description: A complex sodium calcium magnesium iron aluminum silicate amphibole, found in metamorphic and some igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pectolite
data.Description: A sodium calcium silicate hydroxide mineral, known for its fibrous radiating forms, found in cavities in basalt and other volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pentahydrite
data.Description: A magnesium sulfate mineral, found in evaporite deposits, often associated with other sulfate minerals.

data.Name: Pentlandite
data.Description: A nickel iron sulfide mineral, the most important ore of nickel, found in ultramafic igneous rocks and meteorites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Periclase
data.Description: A magnesium oxide mineral, found in metamorphosed dolomites and as a product of contact metamorphism.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Perovskite
data.Description: A calcium titanium oxide mineral, found in calcium-rich igneous rocks and kimberlites, important for studies of deep Earth processes.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Petalite
data.Description: A lithium aluminum silicate mineral, used as a source of lithium and in ceramic and glass industries, found in pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Phengite
data.Description: A high-silica variety of muscovite, found in low-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Phillipsite
data.Description: A group of zeolite minerals, found in basaltic rocks and as a product of volcanic ash alteration.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Phlogopite
data.Description: A magnesium-rich mica, used in electrical insulators, found in metamorphic limestones and ultramafic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Phlogopite Biotite
data.Description: A term used to describe mica minerals intermediate between phlogopite and biotite in composition.

data.Name: Phosphate
data.Description: Minerals containing the phosphate anion (PO4)3-, important as fertilizer and in various industrial applications.

data.Name: Pickeringite
data.Description: A magnesium aluminum sulfate mineral, found in arid regions as a product of sulfide oxidation.

data.Name: Picromerite
data.Description: A potassium magnesium sulfate mineral, found in evaporite deposits and as a secondary mineral in ore deposits.

data.Name: Pigeonite
data.Description: A calcium magnesium iron silicate pyroxene, found in volcanic and high-temperature metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Plagioclase
data.Description: A series of tectosilicate minerals within the feldspar group, ranging from albite to anorthite, common in igneous, metamorphic, and sedimentary rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Plumbogummite
data.Description: A lead aluminum phosphate hydroxide mineral, found in the oxidized zones of lead ore deposits.

data.Name: Polyhalite
data.Description: A hydrated potassium calcium magnesium sulfate mineral, found in evaporite deposits, used as a fertilizer.

data.Name: Portlandite
data.Description: A calcium hydroxide mineral, formed during the hydration of Portland cement.

data.Name: Prehnite
data.Description: A calcium aluminum silicate hydroxide mineral, known for its beautiful green crystals, found in cavities in igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Prismatine
data.Description: A boron-bearing amphibole mineral, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pseudobrookite
data.Description: An iron titanium oxide mineral, found in volcanic rocks and as a product of high-temperature oxidation.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pseudomalachite
data.Description: A copper phosphate mineral, found in the oxidized zones of copper ore deposits.

data.Name: Pseudorutile
data.Description: An iron titanium oxide mineral, often formed from the alteration of ilmenite.

data.Name: Pumpellyite-(Al)
data.Description: A variety of pumpellyite with a higher aluminum content, found in low-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pyrite
data.Description: An iron sulfide mineral, known as fool's gold, found in a variety of geological formations from sedimentary deposits to hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pyrochlore
data.Description: A complex niobium tantalum oxide mineral, important as an ore of niobium and tantalum, found in carbonatites and pegmatites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pyrolusite
data.Description: A manganese oxide mineral, the primary ore of manganese, found in sedimentary and hydrothermal deposits.

data.Name: Pyrope
data.Description: A magnesium aluminum garnet, part of the garnet group of minerals, used as a gemstone, found in ultramafic rocks and kimberlites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pyrophanite
data.Description: A manganese titanium oxide mineral, found in metamorphosed manganese-rich sediments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pyrophyllite
data.Description: An aluminum silicate mineral, used in ceramics and as a refractory material, found in metamorphic rocks and hydrothermal deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pyroxene
data.Description: A group of silicate minerals common in igneous and metamorphic rocks, including minerals like augite and diopside.

data.Name: Pyroxferroite
data.Description: An iron-rich pyroxene mineral, found in lunar rocks and some meteorites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pyroxmangite
data.Description: A high-pressure polymorph of rhodonite, a manganese silicate mineral, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Pyrrhotite
data.Description: An iron sulfide mineral, often found in magmatic and hydrothermal deposits, associated with pentlandite in nickel-bearing ores.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Qandilite
data.Description: A magnesium titanium oxide mineral, found in metamorphosed ultramafic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Quartz
data.Description: A silicon dioxide mineral, one of the most common minerals in the Earth's crust, found in a variety of geological environments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ralstonite
data.Description: A hydrated sodium magnesium fluoride carbonate mineral, found in evaporite deposits.

data.Name: Rankinite
data.Description: A calcium silicate mineral, found in contact metamorphosed limestones and as a product of cement clinker.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Realgar
data.Description: An arsenic sulfide mineral, known for its bright red color, found in hydrothermal veins and as a sublimation product around volcanic fumaroles.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Rhodochrosite
data.Description: A manganese carbonate mineral, known for its beautiful pink and red colors, used as a gemstone and ore of manganese, found in hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Rhodonite
data.Description: A manganese silicate mineral, used as a gemstone and ornamental stone, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Richterite
data.Description: A sodium calcium magnesium silicate amphibole, found in metamorphic rocks and some alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Riebeckite
data.Description: A sodium iron silicate amphibole, known as blue asbestos, found in some metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ringwoodite
data.Description: A high-pressure polymorph of olivine, found in the Earth's mantle and in some meteorites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Roedderite
data.Description: A complex sodium magnesium silicate mineral, found in some alkaline igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Rossmanite
data.Description: A lithium-rich tourmaline, found in lithium-bearing pegmatites and granitic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Rutile
data.Description: A titanium dioxide mineral, used in pigments and as a source of titanium, found in metamorphic and igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Rutile Anatase
data.Description: Refers to minerals rutile and anatase, both polymorphs of titanium dioxide, occurring in different crystal forms.

data.Name: Sadanagaite
data.Description: A complex sodium calcium magnesium iron aluminum silicate amphibole, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Sanidine
data.Description: A high-temperature potassium feldspar, found in volcanic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Saponite
data.Description: A magnesium-rich smectite clay mineral, found in hydrothermal environments and as alteration products in basaltic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Sapphirine
data.Description: A magnesium aluminum silicate mineral, known for its blue color, found in high-grade metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Scapolite
data.Description: A group of rock-forming silicate minerals found in high-grade metamorphic rocks and some igneous rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Scheelite
data.Description: A calcium tungstate mineral, an important ore of tungsten, found in hydrothermal veins and skarns.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Schorl
data.Description: A black variety of tourmaline, rich in iron, found in granitic pegmatites and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Schreibersite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Sepiolite
data.Description: A magnesium silicate clay mineral, used in cat litter and as a building material, found in sedimentary deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Sericite
data.Description: A fine-grained muscovite mica, commonly found in metamorphic rocks as a result of alteration.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Serpentine
data.Description: A group of magnesium silicate minerals, common in metamorphosed ultramafic rocks, used as decorative stones and in asbestos materials.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Shortite

data.Name: Siderite
data.Description: An iron carbonate mineral, found in sedimentary rocks and as a gangue mineral in hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Sillimanite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Smectite

data.Name: Smectite Chlorite

data.Name: Smectite Kerolite

data.Name: Smithsonite
data.Description: A zinc carbonate mineral, an ore of zinc, found in the oxidation zones of zinc deposits.

data.Name: Sodalite
data.Description: A sodium aluminum silicate chloride mineral, found in alkaline igneous rocks, used as a gemstone and ornamental stone.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Spessartine
data.Description: A manganese aluminum garnet, used as a gemstone, found in granite pegmatites and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Spessartine Almandine

data.Name: Sphalerite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Spherocobaltite

data.Name: Spinel
data.Description: A magnesium aluminum oxide mineral, used as a gemstone, found in igneous rocks and metamorphosed limestones.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Spodumene

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Spurrite
data.Description: A calcium silicate mineral, found in contact metamorphosed limestones.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Starkeyite
data.Description: A magnesium sulfate mineral, found in evaporite deposits.

data.Name: Staurolite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Stevensite
data.Description: A type of smectite clay mineral, found in lacustrine (lake) sediments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Stilbite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Stilpnomelane

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Stishovite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Strontianite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Sudoite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Sulfur

data.Name: Sulphate
data.Description: Refers to minerals containing the sulfate anion (SO4)2-, such as gypsum and barite.

data.Name: Sulphide
data.Description: Refers to minerals containing the sulfide anion (S)2-, such as pyrite and galena.

data.Name: Susannite
data.Description: A lead sulfate carbonate mineral, found in the oxidized zones of lead ore deposits.

data.Name: Svanbergite

data.Name: Sylvite
data.Description: A potassium chloride mineral, used in fertilizers, found in evaporite deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Taenite (Γ-Fe, Ni)

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Talc

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Taramite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Tennantite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Tenorite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Tephroite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Tetrahedrite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Thomsonite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Thorite
data.Description: A thorium silicate mineral, radioactive, found in granitic pegmatites and hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Tilleyite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Tin Metal
data.Description: Elemental tin, used in alloys such as bronze and in various coatings and solders.

data.Name: Tin Oxide

data.Name: Titanite
data.Description: A calcium titanium silicate mineral, also known as sphene, used as a gemstone, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Topaz
data.Description: A silicate mineral of aluminum and fluorine, used as a gemstone, found in pegmatites and high-temperature quartz veins.

data.Name: Tourmaline

data.Name: Tremolite

data.Name: Tridymite

data.Name: Troilite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Tschermakite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Ulvöspinel

data.Name: Vermiculite

data.Name: Vesuvianite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Wadsleyite

data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Wagnerite
data.Description: A magnesium phosphate fluoride mineral, found in phosphate-rich metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Wairakite
data.Description: A calcium aluminum silicate zeolite mineral, found in hydrothermal systems.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Wavellite
data.Description: A hydrated aluminum phosphate mineral, known for its radial or spherical aggregates, found in hydrothermal veins and phosphate deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Weddellite
data.Description: A calcium oxalate mineral, found in sedimentary rocks and as a biomineral in plants.

data.Name: Whewellite
data.Description: Another form of calcium oxalate, found in sedimentary rocks and as a biomineral in certain plants.

data.Name: Whitlockite
data.Description: A calcium phosphate mineral, found in igneous rocks and meteorites.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Willemite
data.Description: A zinc silicate mineral, used as an ore of zinc and as a gemstone, found in metamorphosed zinc deposits.

data.Name: Willmenite
data.Description: Likely a misspelling of ilmenite, a titanium-iron oxide mineral, found in igneous and metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Winchite
data.Description: A complex sodium calcium magnesium iron silicate amphibole, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Witherite
data.Description: A barium carbonate mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and as a secondary mineral in barium deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Wollastonite
data.Description: A calcium silicate mineral, used in ceramics, paints, and plastics, found in contact metamorphosed limestones.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Woodhouseite
data.Description: A calcium aluminum phosphate sulfate mineral, found in hydrothermal veins and altered rocks.

data.Name: Wurtzite
data.Description: A zinc sulfide mineral, similar to sphalerite but with a different crystal structure, found in hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Wüstite
data.Description: An iron oxide mineral, found in steel-making furnaces and as a subproduct of various industrial processes.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Xenotime
data.Description: A yttrium phosphate mineral, used as a source of yttrium and heavy rare earth elements, found in pegmatites and hydrothermal veins.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Xonotlite
data.Description: A calcium silicate mineral, found in contact metamorphosed limestones and as a product of hydrothermal alteration.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Yttrium Aluminium Garnet
data.Description: A synthetic crystalline material used in lasers and as a gemstone substitute.

data.Name: Yugawaralite
data.Description: A calcium aluminum silicate zeolite mineral, found in hydrothermal environments.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Zeolite
data.Description: A group of hydrated aluminosilicate minerals, used in water softeners and as molecular sieves, found in volcanic rocks and altered ash layers.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Zincite
data.Description: A zinc oxide mineral, used as an ore of zinc and in the manufacture of zinc compounds, found in metamorphosed zinc deposits.

data.Name: Zinnwaldite
data.Description: A lithium iron aluminum mica, found in pegmatites and associated with other lithium-bearing minerals.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Zircon
data.Description: A zirconium silicate mineral, used as a gemstone and an important source of zirconium, found in igneous rocks and detrital deposits.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.

data.Name: Zoisite
data.Description: A calcium aluminum silicate mineral, part of the epidote group, known for its variety tanzanite, found in metamorphic rocks.
data.AttributionPublication: Whitney, D.L. (2010) Abbreviation for names of rock-forming minerals. American Mineralogist, 95, 185-187.
